public ZKSetMembershipProver(PublicKey pub,
                             java.math.BigInteger[] theSet,
                             int msgIndex,
                             EncryptedInteger cipherVal)
                      throws ZKSetMembershipException,
                             BigIntegerClassNotValid
Constructs the class using BigInteger for big integers

Parameters:
pub - the public key
theSet - the set we want to prove cipherVal is in
msgIndex - the index we are claiming cipherVal is in theSet
cipherVal - the cipher text for the proof
Throws:
ZKSetMembershipException
BigIntegerClassNotValid

pub - the public key
theSet - the set we want to prove cipherVal is in
msgIndex - the index we are claiming cipherVal is in theSet
cipherVal - the cipher text for the proof

Method Detail

genCommitments

public java.math.BigInteger[] genCommitments()
                                      throws ZKSetMembershipException,
                                             BigIntegerClassNotValid
Generates the commitments for proving that the cipher text is in the given set. The commitments are returned and should be sent to the verifier.

Returns:
the commitments
Throws:
ZKSetMembershipException
BigIntegerClassNotValid

genChallengeFromCommitments

public java.math.BigInteger genChallengeFromCommitments(java.math.BigInteger[] uVals,
                                                        java.math.BigInteger A)
Uses the idea behind the Fiat-Shamir paradigm to generate the challenge for a non-interactive proof

Parameters:
uVals - the commitments generated by the prover
A - the challenge length (should be agreed upon in advance with the verifier). The probability that a prover can successfully cheat is 1/A. A should be a power of 2.
Returns:
the challenge

genChallengeFromCommitments

public java.math.BigInteger genChallengeFromCommitments(java.math.BigInteger[] uVals)
Calls genChallengeFromCommitments(BigInteger[] uVals, BigInteger A) with A equal to 128

Parameters:
uVals - the commitments generated by the prover
Returns:
the challenge

computeResponse

public void computeResponse(java.math.BigInteger e,
                            java.math.BigInteger r)
                     throws ZKSetMembershipException,
                            BigIntegerClassNotValid
Computes the provers response to the challenge e. The prover should then use getVs() and getEs() and send those values to the verifier.

Parameters:
e - the challenge
r - the random number used during encryption
Throws:
ZKSetMembershipException
BigIntegerClassNotValid

getVs

public java.math.BigInteger[] getVs()
The V values needed for the last part of the proof

Returns:
the v values

getEs

public java.math.BigInteger[] getEs()
The E values needed for the last part of the proof

Returns:
the e values
